class.name: Phaser.Device
class.help: Detects device support capabilities. Using some elements from System.js by MrDoob and Modernizr

public.name: canPlayAudio

returns.help: True if the given file type is supported by the browser, otherwise false.

public.help: Check whether the host environment can play audio.

public.name: checkFullScreenSupport
public.help: Checks for support of the Full Screen API.

public.name: isConsoleOpen

returns.help: True if the browser dev console is open.

public.help: Check whether the console is open.\nNote that this only works in Firefox with Firebug and earlier versions of Chrome.\nIt used to work in Chrome, but then they removed the ability: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink?view=revision&revision=151136

private.name: _checkBrowser
private.help: Check what browser is game running in.

private.name: _checkCSS3D
private.help: Check whether the host environment support 3D CSS.

private.name: _checkDevice
private.help: Check PixelRatio, iOS device, Vibration API, ArrayBuffers and endianess.

private.name: _checkFeatures
private.help: Check HTML5 features of the host environment.

private.name: _checkIsLittleEndian
private.help: Check Little or Big Endian system.

private.name: _checkIsUint8ClampedImageData
private.help: Test to see if ImageData uses CanvasPixelArray or Uint8ClampedArray.

private.name: _checkOS
private.help: Check which OS is game running on.

public.name: android
public.inlineHelp: Is running on android?

public.name: arora
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Arora.

public.name: audioData
public.inlineHelp: Are Audio tags available?

public.name: cancelFullscreen
public.inlineHelp: If the browser supports the Full Screen API this holds the call you need to use to cancel it.

public.name: canvas
public.inlineHelp: Is canvas available?

public.name: chrome
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Chrome.

public.name: chromeOS
public.inlineHelp: Is running on chromeOS?

public.name: cocoonJS
public.inlineHelp: Is the game running under CocoonJS?

public.name: cocoonJSApp
public.inlineHelp: Is this game running with CocoonJS.App?

public.name: cordova
public.inlineHelp: Is the game running under Apache Cordova?

public.name: crosswalk
public.inlineHelp: Is the game running under the Intel Crosswalk XDK?

public.name: css3D
public.inlineHelp: Is css3D available?

public.name: desktop
public.inlineHelp: Is running desktop?

public.name: ejecta
public.inlineHelp: Is the game running under Ejecta?

public.name: epiphany
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Epiphany.

public.name: file
public.inlineHelp: Is file available?

public.name: fileSystem
public.inlineHelp: Is fileSystem available?

public.name: firefox
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Firefox.

public.name: fullscreen
public.inlineHelp: Does the browser support the Full Screen API?

public.name: fullscreenKeyboard
public.inlineHelp: Does the browser support access to the Keyboard during Full Screen mode?

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running game.

public.name: getUserMedia
public.inlineHelp: Does the device support the getUserMedia API?

public.name: iOS
public.inlineHelp: Is running on iOS?

public.name: iPad
public.inlineHelp: Is running on iPad?

public.name: iPhone
public.inlineHelp: Is running on iPhone?

public.name: iPhone4
public.inlineHelp: Is running on iPhone4?

public.name: ie
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Internet Explorer.

public.name: ieVersion
public.inlineHelp: If running in Internet Explorer this will contain the major version number. Beyond IE10 you should use Device.trident and Device.tridentVersion.

public.name: linux
public.inlineHelp: Is running on linux?

public.name: littleEndian
public.inlineHelp: Is the device big or little endian? (only detected if the browser supports TypedArrays)

public.name: localStorage
public.inlineHelp: Is localStorage available?

public.name: m4a
public.help: Can this device play m4a files?
public.inlineHelp: True if this device can play m4a files.

public.name: macOS
public.inlineHelp: Is running on macOS?

public.name: midori
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Midori.

public.name: mobileSafari
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Mobile Safari.

public.name: mp3
public.inlineHelp: Can this device play mp3 files?

public.name: mspointer
public.inlineHelp: Is mspointer available?

public.name: node
public.inlineHelp: Is the game running under Node.js?

public.name: nodeWebkit
public.inlineHelp: Is the game running under Node-Webkit?

public.name: ogg
public.inlineHelp: Can this device play ogg files?

public.name: opera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Opera.

public.name: opus
public.inlineHelp: Can this device play opus files?

public.name: pixelRatio
public.inlineHelp: PixelRatio of the host device?

public.name: pointerLock
public.inlineHelp: Is Pointer Lock available?

public.name: quirksMode
public.inlineHelp: Is the browser running in strict mode (false) or quirks mode? (true)

public.name: requestFullscreen
public.inlineHelp: If the browser supports the Full Screen API this holds the call you need to use to activate it.

public.name: safari
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in Safari.

public.name: silk
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running in the Silk browser (as used on the Amazon Kindle)

public.name: support32bit
public.inlineHelp: Does the device context support 32bit pixel manipulation using array buffer views?

public.name: touch
public.inlineHelp: Is touch available?

public.name: trident
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running a Trident version of Internet Explorer (IE11+)

public.name: tridentVersion
public.inlineHelp: If running in Internet Explorer 11 this will contain the major version number. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/ms537503(v=vs.85).aspx

public.name: typedArray
public.inlineHelp: Does the browser support TypedArrays?

public.name: vibration
public.inlineHelp: Does the device support the Vibration API?

public.name: wav
public.inlineHelp: Can this device play wav files?

public.name: webApp
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if running as a WebApp, i.e. within a WebView

public.name: webAudio
public.inlineHelp: Is the WebAudio API available?

public.name: webGL
public.inlineHelp: Is webGL available?

public.name: webm
public.inlineHelp: Can this device play webm files?

public.name: windows
public.inlineHelp: Is running on windows?

public.name: windowsPhone
public.inlineHelp: Is running on a Windows Phone?

public.name: worker
public.inlineHelp: Is worker available?
